entry.et: Middle English, from Old English thurst; akin to Old High German durst thirst, Latin torrēre to dry, parch, Old Irish tart dryness, thirst, Greek tersesthai to become dry

def.dt: :a sensation of dryness in the mouth and throat associated with a desire for liquids
:the bodily condition (as of dehydration) that induces this sensation
:an ardent desire :craving longing a thirst for success
